problem_statement: ngesting data into MISP (Malware Information Sharing Platform) often leads to

issues where indicators exist in isolation without context. The engineering challenge here is two-fold: First, the model must construct complex MISP Objects (using the file template) rather than simple attributes to represent the malware, requiring correct key-value mapping against the template definition. Second, and most critically, it must build a specific Graph Topology. The model must successfully link the file Object to a standalone url Attribute using the specific relationship predicate downloaded-from. Naive implementations often fail to establish this edge or incorrectly attempt to link two objects instead of an object and an attribute. Additionally, the requirement for Idempotency is a logic trap; standard pymisp.add_object calls will create duplicate entries on every run unless the script explicitly checks for existing hashes or handles UIDs deterministically.
